basics.name: Kelly Hwang
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science, Data Science Track in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawai'i at Mānoa. I expect to graduate in Spring 2023.

education.institution: University of Hawai'i at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI
education.area: Computer Science, Data Science Track (expected Spring, 2023)

education.institution: University of Hawai'i at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI
education.area: Economics, with Quantitative Economics Concentration (expected Spring, 2023)

work.company: Water Resources Research Center at University of Hawai’i at Mānoa
highlights: Providing computer science and information technology support across various research opportunities and data portals
Applying data science algorithms to work with data and applying prepackaged software stacks to relevant project tasks
Technologies used: Linux environment, Ansible, Docker, DKAN, SQL, Node

work.company: Ames Research Center, National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
highlights: Analyzed and processed data for unsteady pressure sensitive paint (uPSP) project by cross-correlating kulite microphone and uPSP data for a new wind tunnel pressure measurement system, and additional statistical research
Produced multiple PSDs using Python scripts to show cross-correlation, time lag, and decay at sampled frequencies
Technologies used: Python, Linux environment, data visualization, script automation

volunteer.organization: Board of Student Activities at Kapi’olani Community College
highlights: Collaborated within a diverse college student-run chartered student organization, significantly contributed to the group’s organization via budget strategies, administrative functions, and all key functions of student activities management

Launched multiple campus-wide events, hosted a variety of online events, created various posters and videos, executed Instagram and Youtube video campaigns in collaboration with campus departments, all with COVID-19 restrictions
Utilized local hospitality network to bolster engagement and drive business by organizing public and private events

Founded and nurtured a platform of Hong Kong expatriates by curating relevant content to assist with the organic audience growth on social media, namely Facebook and Instagram, leading to a 10x growth in engagement and followers
Vice President of Communications, SWITCH (Supporting Women in Information Technology & Computing in Hawai'i), 2021-Present
Student Chapter Member, ACM@MANOA (Association for Computing Machinery), 2021-Present
Student Representative, PAU Violence Coalition at Kapi'olani Community College, 2020-Present

projects.title: Bloombugs Kahukai Application
highlights: Placed 2nd overall out of 44 teams

Created a web application for HACC 2021's Hawai'i Marine Animal Response (HMAR), NIC Hawaii. This sighting and reporting app is to help streamline the process for the public to report monk seals, turtles, and seabirds, to be on a 24/7 web app instead of by call logs
Technologies used: Meteor, MongoDB, React, Semantic UI, Javascript, HTML/CSS

projects.title: Autorotating Science Payload Relay Mission
highlights: Designed a launchable canister satellite and ejectable autorotating maple seed projectiles according to set objectives
Developed the electrical engineering team’s sensor, communication & data handling, electrical power, flight software, and ground control station subsystems for final competition review
Technologies used: Arudino, MQTT, Visual Studio

projects.organizer: Virtual NASA Community College Aerospace Scholars (VNCAS)
projects.title: A NASA Experience
highlights: Accepted into virtual NASA experience for July 2021 by engaging in self-paced modules about NASA missions, aeronautics, and in-situ resource utilization capabilities
Competed in an interactive team competition to plan a lunar mission and placed second
Selected to be the budget officer and mission schedule analyst, assisted in producing daily deliverables during the two weeks

projects.title: nFloo
projects.summary: H4R organized by the UH Office of Innovation and Commercialization
highlights: Engaged in an intensive 5-day bootcamp in diversifying Hawai’i's economy after COVID-19 through lean startup method
Implemented entrepreneurial strategies to create a social media platform to connect clients with their audience

projects.title: Indigenous Knowledge in Engineering
highlights: Created personal project in sustainability, 'Using LEDs for Visible Spectrum Color Therapy Along a Temporal Axis'
Arduino microcontrollers to write code to visually represent time changing every day in an LED panel
